thread.title: Emmerdale beats EastEnders to the serial drama prize at the NTAs for the first time
thread.title_full: Emmerdale beats EastEnders to the serial drama prize at the NTAs for the first time

author: Vicki Newman
title: Emmerdale beats EastEnders to the serial drama prize at the NTAs for the first time
text:
Emmerdale beats EastEnders to the serial drama prize at the NTAs for the first time Fans were happy to see the show "finally" win the award Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now Emmerdale take home the prestigious 'Best Soap' award at the NTAs Share this video Get soaps updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
Emmerdale fans are rejoicing after the show "finally" beat EastEnders at the National Television Awards. 
For years, the BBC One soap has dominated the NTAs , taking home the Serial Drama award a number of times. 
But this year, it was ITV's Emmerdale that picked up the coveted prize. 
Loose Women's Penny Lancaster and Ayda Field announced the shock victory as the Yorkshire-based soap claimed the gong over EastEnders, Coronation Street and Hollyoaks. 
Actor Danny Miller celebrated my necking his drink then dabbing in the aisle. Read More Who has won the NTAs 2017? Results in full for all the National Television Awards categories Emmerdale stars celebrate as they win best serial drama (Photo: ITV) 
The stars of rival soaps and people in the audience rose to their feet in a standing ovation as cast members and creatives behind Emmerdale took to the stage as the show's theme music played. 
Jeff Hordley, who plays Cain Dingle, said: "Wow thank you so much, this is a first for us. This is a first and we are so, so grateful. Thank you to everyone who voted, it means a lot. 
"I'd like to start by thanking our brilliant, superb crew, who work so many more hours than us, that's for you that one Rob, you really do, and also the entire writing time for giving us such brilliant stories, and also to our brilliant producer who's probably hiding back there, Mr Iain Macleod." The cast gather together on stage (Photo: ITV) 
Fans took to Twitter to share their delight. 
One wrote: "Very well deserved award to @emmerdale !! Finally getting the credit they deserve tonight!" Danny Miller celebrated by dabbing (Photo: ITV) 
Another posted: "Brilliant! Soooo well deserved. Can we have a victory dance with Rishi in full Granny Clegg ad get up". 
"I'm surprised it's Emmerdale's first NTA! It makes a welcome change for millions from Coronation Street and EastEnders winning," posted another. 
Another fan wrote: "Huge congratulations, Emmerdale! Truly well deserved! " Like us on Facebook
